candidates.title: sdk: release v0.0.3
candidates.body: Release v0.0.3 of the sdk

candidates.title: [api] post /transactions to submit bcs encoded signed transaction
candidates.body:
#9193

* submit transaction by post bcs encoded SignedTransaction to /transactions.
* response a pending transaction serialized from the SignedTransaction, include transaction hash.
* response 400 for invalid transaction or mempool rejection errors.
* response 202 accepted if mempool accepts the transactions.
* will have a follow up PR to render a Location header for looking up transaction by hash (after we implement GET /transactions/<txn-hash>)

candidates.title: [move-prover][spec-flatten] basic skeleton for a spec-flattening tool
candidates.body:
This PR contains the skeleton for an experimental tool, spec-flatten, that aims to reduce spec boilerplate and producing more readable specs.

The tool is currently in a very early stage and does only one thing:
for each `aborts_if` in a function spec, test whether it is redundant.
It achieves this by removing the `aborts_if` and check whether the function spec can still be proved.

More functionalities will be added to the tool later, such as
- spec unrolling
- spec simplification

To run the tool:
```bash
cd language/move-prover/tools/spec-flatten
cargo run -- ../../../diem-framework/core/sources/AccountCreationScripts.move -d ../../../diem-framework/core/sources -d ../../../move-stdlib/sources
```

Expect results like:
```
fun AccountCreationScripts::create_child_vasp_account
  Number of aborts_if trimmed: 32 (out of 60)
fun AccountCreationScripts::create_designated_dealer
  Number of aborts_if trimmed: 18 (out of 43)
......
```

## Motivation

Experimental tool on ideas of reducing spec boilerplate and producing more readable specs

### Have you read the [Contributing Guidelines on pull requests](https://github.com/diem/diem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests)?

Yes

## Test Plan

Not much test cases have been written yet. Testing this tool mostly rely on running it over the DPN code.

candidates.title: [exec_bench] unify diemdb_bench and exec_bench with same txn gen
candidates.body:
## Motivation

To facilitate executor benchmarking, we move `diemdb-benchmark` into `executor-benchmark` after we use the same txn gen/exec/commit mods.

Now it supports two subcommand to create a base db or run an executor benchmarking on an existing base db by creating a checkpoint db and keep the base db untouched (internally using hardlinks, a feature of rocksdb). So the same base db can be reused again and again, which is especially helpful to benchmarking on huge dataset because creating a huge db with real txns needs a long time.

This PR includes:
1. Move `diemdb-benchmark` into `executor-benchmark` as `db-generation` mod.
2. Change `db-generation` code to store accounts info into a META file which can be read by executor bench to run. Otherwise it doesn't know what accounts exist in the existing db.
3. Change the cmd args to make them two separate subcommands for understandability.
4. refactor tests.

### Have you read the [Contributing Guidelines on pull requests]
Y

## Test Plan
- diemdb creation
`cargo run -- create-db --data-dir=/tmp/test --num-accounts=100`
- executor benchmark on top of diemdb just created, specifying the same `--db-dir`
` cargo run -- run-executor --data-dir=/tmp/test --checkpoint-dir=/tmp/cp --blocks=10`

candidates.title: [network] support registering client-only or service-only applications

labels.name: network
labels.description: Validator and full node p2p network

candidates.body:
+ The network builder now supports registering client-only or service-only applications. Right now, we're just unioning all client, service, and p2p required protocols together to get the complete set of protocols needed. In a follow up, I'll probably make the registration a bit safer so it keeps track of client and service protocols separately and panics if we try to register two services to the same protocol.

+ Rename `SupportedProtocols` => `ProtocolIdSet`.

+ Add `ProtocolIdSet::union`.

candidates.title: [State Sync] Add the (skeleton) Diem Data Client API and crate.
candidates.body:
## Motivation

This PR adds an (empty) skeleton "Diem Data Client" crate and a corresponding client API to the code. This decouples State Sync v2 and the Diem Data Client, allowing the workstreams to progress in parallel.

Notes:
- This crate is owned by @phlip9. For now, I've put the crate in the `state-sync` subfolder (to match the `storage-service`). But, we may wish to move it in the future. I don't feel super strongly here.
- The API is not final or complete. What is offered here is a simple starting point to decouple the workstreams. Moreover, many of the implementation details (e.g., errors) are subject to change 😄

### Have you read the [Contributing Guidelines on pull requests](https://github.com/diem/diem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests)?

Yes.

## Test Plan

This is only the interface. No tests required.

## Related PRs

None, but this PR relates to: https://github.com/diem/diem/issues/8906

candidates.title: [api] get transactions
candidates.body:
#9193
* get transactions by start and limit params.
* start is default to latest ledger version if not provided.
* limit is default to 25 if not provided.
* event data is deserialized based on the move type associated (same with account resources).
* u64 is rendered into string.
* bytes are rendered into "0x" prefixed hex string.
* 3 transaction types are rendered.
* transaction payload, signature and vm status are not rendered yet, will have follow up PR to handle them.

Transactions response sample:

```
[
  {
    "type": "block_metadata",
    "version": "1",
    "hash": "0x080cec4567040175bd50eb4d8ae7ac98016a5b305fe45cf9d654e44bddefa40a",

    "event_root_hash": "0xcf7eb072cb6ecce85709aa7c99ca361d47db656391887e78b5153975ae5e2c6a",
    "gas_used": "100000000",
    "success": true,
    "id": "0x965c6c57bb97dd6ff055344815d5b7d58778e500c30efbf155dce2a8b3580da8",
    "round": "1",
    "previous_block_votes": [],
    "proposer": "0x652f27413456938eaa059f65231647cc"
  },
  {
    "type": "user_transaction",
    "version": "2",
    "hash": "0xb085f3ae1714f020001fb1cec7b3d72400b696b9c9eeb562d6bc6700ef1fbe5c",
    "state_root_hash": "0xf751a02bac87b51d8bb3260fa38065229780c010f70d4f94f25ea0114d6c9203",
    "event_root_hash": "0x9c8a7bce561c0604d725bdef5d43947fe2e77aac7f4cbc21ac35dcceb74d9124",

        "key": "0x00000000000000000000000000000000000000000a550c18",
```

candidates.title: [network] clean up SupportedProtocols. support iterating with unknown ProtocolIds

labels.name: network
labels.description: Validator and full node p2p network

candidates.body:
Previously, when iterating over a SupportedProtocols that contains an
unknown ProtocolId (that we can't decode yet) we would Err out of the
whole iteration.

With this change, we can safely iterate over a SupportedProtocols; it
will just ignore any ProtocolId's we can't decode.

candidates.title: [benchmark] refactor exec/diemdb benchmarks to store real txn data in db
candidates.body:
## Motivation

We refactor for the following purpose:
1. Store real txn execution results in db rather than random bytes to reflect real data size.
2. The db generated could be reused for further execution benchmarking.
3. We still need a metadata file to report db properties (accounts, keys) as input for executor benchmark.

### Have you read the [Contributing Guidelines on pull requests]
Y

## Test Plan

cargo run for both benchmarks.

candidates.title: [network] Make NetworkInterface use PeerNetworkId as a key

labels.name: network
labels.description: Validator and full node p2p network

candidates.body:
## Motivation

Through integration with Mempool, it's clear that we need to be able to use combined storage across Networks to be able to share a single interface (rather than making a proxy shared interface to handle multiple).  This could come with some sort of performance issues from locking, but we should be able to get around that later by only locking information on a per network level.

A lot of the changes are from moving `PeerNetworkId`'s location to a more sensible one, in it's own commit.

### Have you read the [Contributing Guidelines on pull requests](https://github.com/diem/diem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests)?

Yes

## Test Plan

Current tests

candidates.title: [State Sync] Complete the storage service skeleton (server-side).
candidates.body:
## Motivation

This PR completes the skeleton for the server-side of the storage service. Specifically, it stubs out the logic required for the remaining API calls (`get_transaction_outputs_with_proof()` and `get_account_states_chunk_with_proof()`) and adds support for fetching relevant metadata regarding these calls. With this PR, we now have a skeleton for the server side of the storage service that can be filled in to provide all the data we need for state sync v2.

The PR offers the following commits:
1. Add a skeleton for the `get_transaction_outputs_with_proof()` API call. For now, the API call will return an error as we're waiting for `TransactionOutputs` to be supported by the DB.
2. Add a skeleton for the `get_account_states_chunk_with_proof()` API call. This requires introducing a new type `AccountStatesChunkWithProof` that will be implemented/completed in a follow up PR. For now, the API call will return an error.
3. Expand the storage server summary to include information about the transactions, epochs, transaction outputs and account states chunks held by the server. For now, we *naively* assume all nodes hold all of this data up to the version they are currently synced to, however, we'll need change this in the future once the DB supports relevant calls to fetch this information.

### Have you read the [Contributing Guidelines on pull requests](https://github.com/diem/diem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests)?

Yes.

## Test Plan

Several simple unit tests cover the storage service implementation.

## Related PRs

None, but this PR relates to: https://github.com/diem/diem/issues/8906

candidates.title: [api] get account resources
candidates.body:
New REST API get account resources:

1. Returns a list of resources if account state blob is found.
2. Returns 404 error if account state blob is not found
3. Account address is rendered as compact hex string (trimmed leading 0s) with "0x" prefix.
4. Handler accepts any valid account address in the URL path.
5. Bytes (byte array/vector) are encoded as hex string.

Refactoring:
1. Change InternalError to Error with code field to specify response status code.
2. Re-org tests and endpoint handlers code structure, grouped handler and tests together.

## Test Plan

Unit test

candidates.title: [diem-framework] Add force shift event to CRSNs, add gate
candidates.body:
This PR updates CRSNs to:

* Be able to be turned on after the new Diem Framework code is released
* To emit a `ForceShiftEvent` whenever a force shift event occurs

It also adds tests to make sure that the gating is respected in the Framework, and that `ForceShiftEvents` are emitted when force shifting.

candidates.title: [State Sync] Add a new Storage Service implementation (server-side)
candidates.body:
## Motivation

This PR adds a new server-side implementation for the Storage Service. The Storage Service is an inter-node service allowing Diem nodes to request storage data (e.g., transactions and proofs) directly from other nodes over the Diem network. This PR sets up the framework (template) for this service by implementing the plumbing between request/response processing from the server-side, as well as outlines the required interface between the server and local Diem DB. 

To achieve this, the PR offers 2 commits:
1. Add the new server implementation (as a library to later be exposed over the network)
2. Add several (simple) tests for the server implementation. These will need to be improved and expanded in the future.

Notes:
- The implementation offered here is by no means complete (and you'll notice many TODOs). Instead, this PR is meant to set up the framework so that we can start building on the server-side implementation and make the Storage Service a living thing 😄

### Have you read the [Contributing Guidelines on pull requests](https://github.com/diem/diem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests)?

Yes.

## Test Plan

A set of simple unit tests have been added for this functionality.

## Related PRs

None, but this PR relates to: https://github.com/diem/diem/issues/8906

candidates.title: [mempool/state-sync] Remove NodeNetworkId & modernize PeerNetworkId
candidates.body:
## Motivation

NodeNetworkId was built for allowing duplicate networks as a hack around
having two authentication modes on a single public interface.  This has
since been fixed, so this should really clean up the code.

Additionally, made `PeerNetworkId` hopefully something that can be used elsewhere / is more consistent with our other objects (not using tuples and having a constructor / non-public innards)

Also, ensures all nodes do not have a second public network by ensuring uniqueness on NetworkId.

### Have you read the [Contributing Guidelines on pull requests](https://github.com/diem/diem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests)?

Yes

## Test Plan

Current tests

## Related PRs

N/A

candidates.body:
<!--
Thank you for sending a PR. We appreciate you spending time to help improve the Diem project.

The project is undergoing daily changes. Pull Requests will be reviewed and responded to as time permits.
-->

## Motivation

Maintaining a copy of Diem Framework modules in shuffle folder is not sustainable. This PR removes these copies. However, this means that we'll have to stick with all the DPN specific concepts/functionalities for now. We'll live with it until the refactoring of DF is done.


### Have you read the [Contributing Guidelines on pull requests](https://github.com/diem/diem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests)?

Yes.

candidates.title: [State Sync] Plug in the new EventSubscriptionService.
candidates.body:
## Motivation

This PR replaces the existing `SubscriptionService` used by state sync with the recently added `EventSubscriptionService` (see [here](https://github.com/diem/diem/pull/9117)). The benefits of this change include: (i) better encapsulation between the service and subscribers, e.g., we don't leak so many implementation details; (ii) reconfiguration subscribers are now automatically subscribed to all configs, simplifying the code -- note there was a bug with mempool in regards to this, i.e., it was expecting to listen to something that it never subscribed to (!); (iii) subscribers can actively now listen to events; and (iv) all of the messy code is now simplified and located in one place 😄 

To achieve this, the PR offers 5 commits:
1. Update mempool to listen to the `EventSubscriptionService`.
2. Update consensus to listen to the `EventSubscriptionService`. 
3. Update network to listen to the `EventSubscriptionService`.
4. Update state sync to drive the `EventSubscriptionService`.
5. Remove the old `SubscriptionService`.

Notes:
- I'm not proud of how I managed to hook up the network builder (i.e., in commit 3), but it seems to be okay. The network folks might want to re-think this in the future.

### Have you read the [Contributing Guidelines on pull requests](https://github.com/diem/diem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests)?

Yes.

## Test Plan

Existing unit and integration tests should cover this change.

## Related PRs

None, but this PR relates to: https://github.com/diem/diem/issues/8906

candidates.title: [State Sync] Use the claim crate for better test assertions
candidates.body:
## Motivation

This PR updates all state sync code to utilize the [claim](https://crates.io/crates/claim) crate for better assertion support. While I'm generally reluctant of adding new crate dependencies to code, the claim crate provides much nicer error messages on assertion failures and avoids situations where assertion failures produce unhelpful outputs (e.g., see here: https://github.com/diem/diem/issues/9062). Instead, using claim, we now get error messages like:

Failure on `assert_matches!`:
```
thread 'coordinator::tests::test_new_and_lost_peers' panicked at 'assertion failed, expression does not match any of the given variants.
    expression: Ok(())
    variants: Err(Error::InvalidStateSyncPeer(..))', state-sync/state-sync-v1/src/coordinator.rs:1978:9
```

Failure on `assert_ok!`:

```
thread 'tests::test_missing_configs' panicked at 'assertion failed, expected Ok(..), got Err(CannotSubscribeToZeroEventKeys)', state-sync/inter-component/event-notifications/src/tests.rs:398:5
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace

```

Moreover, using the crate has: (i) made the tests more readable (i.e., it allows the reader to better distinguish between general unwraps/expects and the assertions the test cares about); and (ii) reduced the lines of code (e.g., due to having native support for things like `assert_matches`). Finally, we note that this dependency is test-only.

The PR offers the following commits:
1. Adopt claim for consensus notifications
2. Adopt claim for mempool notifications
3. Adopt claim for state sync
4. Adopt claim for event notifications

Note: this is a follow-up to: https://github.com/diem/diem/pull/9124 (after a recommendation by @zekun000 😄).

### Have you read the [Contributing Guidelines on pull requests](https://github.com/diem/diem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests)?

Yes.

## Test Plan

The existing unit tests cover these changes.

## Related PRs

None, but this PR relates to: https://github.com/diem/diem/issues/8906
